intro: Baissea micrantha, commonly known as the small-flowered baissea, is a flowering plant native to Africa. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant is characterized by its small, white to pinkish flowers that bloom in clusters. Its leaves are typically opposite and have a rounded or ovate shape. Baissea micrantha is often found in moist, shaded habitats such as forests or along stream banks.
